info.name: Kudo-o-Matic
info.description:
This is the API documentation of the Kudo-o-Matic REST API that is used by the Kudo-o-Mobile app.

API resource requests and responses are structured according to the JSON API specification (http://jsonapi.org/).

To obtain an API-token, the Kudo-o-Mobile app has to POST the callback data that it retrieves from a Google OAuth 2.0 sign in event to the authtenication/obtain_api_token endpoint.

API resources can be queried by using the querystring parameters explained on this page: https://github.com/cerebris/jsonapi-resources/wiki/JSONAPI::Resources-Querystring-Examples

request.description: Retrieves the Balance with the corresponding :id.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Runtime
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

request.description:
Adds a new Transaction based on the provided data attributes in the body of the request.
The body should contain the Transaction _amount_ and _activity_ attributes and _receiver_ (User) relationship.
The _image_ and _image-file-type_ attributes are optional.
The Content-Type request header should be set to _application/vnd.api+json_.

request.description:
Retrieves a unique API token and user id by providing the callback data that was retrieved from a Google OAuth 2.0 sign in event.
The body should contain the _jwt_ _token_, _uid_, _provider_, _name_, _email_ and _avatar_ _url_ attributes.

request.description: Stores the provided FCM token that is used for Firebase Cloud Messaging notifications for the User that is assocciated with the provided API-token. The body should contain the _fcm_ _token_ attribute.

response.name: authentication/store_fcm_token
